{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2503.21669v1", "title": "Proton-Driven Plasma Wakefield Acceleration for Future HEP Colliders", "summary": "We discuss the main elements of a collider facility based on proton-driven
plasma wakefield acceleration. We show that very competitive luminosities could
be reached for high energy $e^+e^-$ colliders. A first set of parameters was
developed for a Higgs Factory indicating that such a scheme is indeed
potentially feasible. There are clearly many challenges to the development of
this scheme, including novel RF acceleration modules and high precision and
strong magnets for the proton driver. Challenges in the plasma acceleration
stage include the ability to accelerate positrons while maintaining necessary
emittance and the energy transfer efficiency from the driver to the witness.
Since many exciting applications would become available from our approach, its
development should be pursued.", "main_category": "physics.acc-ph", "categories": "physics.acc-ph,hep-ex,physics.plasm-ph", "published": "2025-03-27T16:36:33Z"}
